posts.title: Enjoy Time With Friends and Family During the 2023 Rogers Cycling Festival
posts.content:
Enjoy the beautiful scenery, roads, and trails of Rogers during the 2023 Rogers Cycling Festival, promising a family-friendly day of fun for the cycling community on Sep 9.

Cycling Community: Over the years, the Rogers Cycling Festival has raised over $100,000 for cycling nonprofits and causes in the region. During this year‚Äôs festival, the City of Rogers, in partnership with the Walton Family Foundation, will unveil 12+ mi of new trail around Lake Atalanta.

Take a Ride: Take a leisurely family ride around the Railyard Loop, a 15+ mi trail around the city, from 1-3p. After the ride, unwind in Rider Village at Frisco Plaza, featuring various vendors and entertainment activities. End the day with a free concert at Butterfield Stage, featuring 90s cover band The Mixtapes.

Learn more and register HERE.

posts.title: It‚Äôs Game Week for Arkansas Razorbacks Football
posts.content:
Football season is upon us! The Arkansas Razorbacks Football team will kick off the 2023 season against Western Carolina this Saturday, Sep 2, at War Memorial Stadium in Little Rock.

Looking Good: Last week, six Razorback players landed 2023 Preseason Coaches All-SEC distinctions, with Dwight McGlothern and Raheim Sanders making first-team; KJ Jefferson, Brady Latham, and Beaux Limmer on second-team offense; and Cam Little making third-team.

On the Hill: The 2023 season schedule has Razorback fans headed to the state capital for the first game, then Fayetteville will welcome fans to Donald W. Reynolds Stadium on Saturday, Sep 9, when the Hogs host Kent State.

Last week, we hosted a drawing for 2 Season Tickets through our Instagram. Thanks to all who entered, and congrats to our lucky winner, Lauren, on the tickets. Woo pig!

posts.title: Botanical Garden of the Ozarks Hosts National Park Radio Concert
posts.content:
Enjoy live music in the garden as the Botanical Garden of the Ozarks continues its Terrific Tuesday series with a National Park Radio concert on Aug 29 from 5:30-8p.

Good Folks: A husband and wife duo out of the Ozarks, National Park Radio is an indie-folk project with a sound reminiscent of Mumford & Sons, The Avett Brothers, and Lumineers. Their latest album, Canyons, was¬†released in May and might just be our new soundtrack pick for this last stretch of summer.

Garden Picnic: Set up your blankets on the Garden lawn and picnic with delicious food options from The Smokin‚Äô Bowl, Carsten Concessions, and Sweet Scoops.

Reserve your free tickets HERE. NWA Daily Picks

posts.title: Benefit the Farmers of Tomorrow with a Happy Hour at the Farm
posts.content:
Join Center for Arkansas Farms & Food for a Happy Hour at the Farm, raising funds for the Farmers of Tomorrow fund, including signature cocktails, dishes made with food grown by Farm School students, and live music.

Seed Money: The Farmers for Tomorrow fund benefits graduates of the CAFF Farm School and Apprenticeship Program, providing seeds and tools for aspiring farmers after they acquire farmland.

Farmraiser: Enjoy canap√©s made especially for the event using food grown by students on the farm and prepared by Chef Haley O‚ÄôBrien while being serenaded by Dandelion Heart. Each guest will receive drink tickets for local beer, Arkansas wines, and a custom cocktail featuring Blackberries from the farm.

Learn more about CAFF and reserve tickets HERE.

posts.title: Local Artists, Comedians, and Monarchs Take Center Stage at the Downtown Springdale ART WALK
posts.content:
From art crawls and comedy shows to vendor fairs and a Monarch Butterfly Parade, Downtown Springdale‚Äôs ART WALK has something for everyone to enjoy on Sep 14-15, from 4-8p, and Sep 16, from 12-6p.

The Perfect Start: The three-day festival kicks off Sep 14 with an ART Crawl from 6-8p, including a drink, featured stops along the ART WALK, and artist meet & greets for just $5. Add some laughter to your Thursday night with Comedy Night at the Apollo on Emma, featuring the ART WALK Comedy Troupe. Shows start at 4p and 8p.

Take Flight: The Monarch Flight Festival will take place Sep 16 from 12-4p at Turnbow Park. A Monarch Parade at 3p will end with the release of newly hatched butterflies at Shiloh Museum. During the event, shop local vendors and artisans as part of the Emma Exchange at Shiloh Square, beginning at noon.

Find more ART WALK details HERE.
